criterion: Reward for accurately documenting the clinician-stated diagnosis of sinus infection exactly as spoken.
Reward for faithfully recording the prescription of penicillin for a 10-day course exactly as stated, including correct drug name and duration.
Reward for capturing the patient’s verbal agreement or intention to start the medication tonight, reflecting the patient’s words or a precise paraphrase.
Reward for correctly incorporating the relevant chart-documented severe penicillin allergy (drug name, reaction, severity) without alteration and while excluding unrelated chart details.
Reward for overall completeness: the note contains every clinically relevant fact, action, and patient response from the transcript and pertinent chart information with no omissions.

Penalize for any omission or incorrect recording of transcript-derived encounter elements such as the sinus infection diagnosis, penicillin prescription drug name or duration, or the patient’s stated plan to start the medication tonight.
Penalize for introducing any clinical content (diagnoses, instructions, medications, histories, assessments, etc.) not verifiable in the transcript or pertinent chart information.
Penalize for copying irrelevant chart data or misrepresenting chart information, including failure to document the severe penicillin allergy or altering its drug name, reaction, or severity.
